conclusion: Need to find the temperature at state C for an ideal gas undergoing a state change.
p-V diagram with points A (1, 3), B (4, 3), and C (4, 1).
Volume increases from 1 x 10^-3 m³ to 4 x 10^-3 m³ at constant pressure from A to B.
Pressure decreases from 3 x 10^5 Pa to 1 x 10^5 Pa at constant volume from B to C.
Temperature at state A is -73°C, which is 200.15 K.
Internal energy change from A to C is 200 J.
Use ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Convert standard pressure from atm to Pa: 1 atm = 101325 Pa.
Volume at standard conditions is 22.4 L = 0.0224 m³.
Calculate number of moles using standard conditions: n ≈ 1.001 mol.
Assume Cv = 5/2 R for diatomic gas.
Verify calculations for n and Cv.
